byline.original: By RAY RIVERA and SANGAR RAHIMI

abstract: Afghan President Hamid Karzai says that his country would support Pakistan if it ever went to war with the United States; appears to be trying to reassure Pakistan after months of increasing tensions while also urging Islamabad to sever its ties to militant extremists.
snippet: The Afghan president appeared to be trying to reassure Pakistan after months of increasing tensions while also urging Islamabad to sever its ties to militant extremists.
lead_paragraph: The Afghan president appeared to be trying to reassure Pakistan after months of increasing tensions while also urging Islamabad to sever its ties to militant extremists.

headline.main: Afghan President Says His Country Would Back Pakistan in a Clash With the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Afghan President Says His Country Would Back Pakistan in a Clash With the U.S.
headline.seo: Karzai Says Afghans Would Back Pakistan in Clash With U.S.
